meanings.definition: Successful in producing a desired or intended result.
meanings.sent1: The new study skills proved to be very effective in improving grades.
meanings.sent2: Using a sharp knife is more effective for cutting vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand was so effective that it made the rabbit disappear instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an effective ray of sunshine on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's quick response was truly effective in saving the house from burning down.

meanings.definition: Having a definite or desired effect.
meanings.sent1: Wearing sunscreen is an effective way to protect your skin from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The medicine was effective in reducing the patient's fever.
meanings.sent3: The detective's effective questioning led to the surprising revelation of the culprit.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an effective arrow hitting the target of truth.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's clear explanation was highly effective in helping the students understand the concept.

meanings.sent1: The new law will be effective starting next month.
meanings.sent2: The security system is very effective in keeping intruders out.
meanings.sent3: The effective alarm system scared away the burglars before they could enter the house.
meanings.sent4: The team's unity was an effective shield against any challenges they faced.
meanings.sent5: The company's new policy proved to be highly effective in increasing productivity among employees.
